website_summaries.verdict: Kids can practice fine motor skills by playing with latches and locks. A fun, engaging toy for the kid who needs to keep his hands busy.
pros: Includes latches that hook, snap, click, and slide
Includes bright colors, numbers, and animals to learn
cons: A few boards came with latches that got stuck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little activity toy for hours of busy time
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when my daughter was only a year old. She loved it. She's 16 months old now and is really getting the gang of it. She latches and unlatches every door/window on her own. She is a hyper girl and this toy keeps her busy for 30 plus minutes each time I give it to her. I don't recommend leaving a child under 2 years old with it without supervision, because it has a few sharp latches that CAN injure them.
customer_reviews.author: AngelTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, not very good quality
customer_reviews.text: The concept is amazing, my son loves opening and closing doors. The quality, though, is not that great. For a 3 year old toddler that is trying to improve his fine motor skills, is just frustrating. Some doors are really hard to open / close because the locks are misplaced or you need a lot of strength.
customer_reviews.author: RoBin

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 20 month old
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves puzzle type activities right now with this one being one of her favorites. It instantly caught her attention and she takes time to actually lock and unlock them. There are also distinctive animals behind the doors as she knows exactly what she’s looking at and makes the correct noise for the ones she knows. I would just be careful if they pick it up because it’s heavy for her. She tries to carry it and she can, but if dropped, I know it will hurt her foot pretty bad. I was skeptical about the price but for how much she likes it, I found it to be worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Very loose latches...my 18 mo was bored
customer_reviews.text: My toddler (18 mo at the time) loves latches and buckles. This toy is super loose and she was able to go through all of them on the first try with no effort. Lost interest on day 2. So I ended up returning it. We have since bought another buckle toy (much sturdier) and she cannot be separated from it.
customer_reviews.author: iko2

customer_reviews.title: the board is sturdy and well made and it's a great educational toy ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler during his lock/latch obsession stage but sadly it just doesn't pique his interest. He played with it for about 10 minutes when we first unwrapped it, but now it sits unused. I don't think the illustrations behind the doors capture his attention and the locks aren't challenging enough. Nonetheless, the board is sturdy and well made and it's a great educational toy for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this for my son but when I opened it and saw how damaged it was I was extremely disappointed. It wasn't damaged from shipping, it was damaged during assembly from what I can tell. Dried glue everywhere, dents and dings all over, scratches on all of the pictures. For the price I was definitely expecting more from this product. Fun toy idea. I'm sure my son will love this for Christmas, but I am seriously disappointed in the quality and craftsmanship for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jenma06

customer_reviews.title: Challenging but not too challenging for 18 month old
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old was able to open up 3 of the latches on her own, but needed help with others. I don’t expect this to be super durable. The latches were rather loose, and I know it’s painted wood, but I think it’ll be good for its purpose while it lasts. Can teach counting, colors, as well as manual dexterity with this. So that’s good. She seemed very interested.
customer_reviews.author: WangATop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea--moderate production flaws
customer_reviews.text: My daughter already loves to play with this board. She is too young to be able to operate all of the latches correctly, but she loves to open and close the doors and fiddle with the latches. However, I can see door #4 causing problems because her father and I can barely get it to latch and unlatch properly. It is clear that it was secured crooked, so it cannot completely lock. Also, a few other locks are secured crooked/loose, so that is something we're going to have to watch out for moving forward. Overall, I love the idea, but I wish it was given a once-over before being shipped because these things could've easily been fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Barrineau

customer_reviews.title: This is the only toy that holds my 2 year olds attention!
customer_reviews.text: We have a mountain of toys, puzzles, games, crafting items etc., etc., but this stands out as the number one favorite. The locks challenge my sons fine motor skills but are still amusing enough to hold his attention for a prolonged period of time. There are animal picture behind each door this these seem to amuse him time after time. He also like to put all the animals to "nite nite" by closing and locking all the doors. This is giftable, durable and has hours of amusement in it. Love, Love, Love!
customer_reviews.author: Tori P.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to play with
customer_reviews.text: I thought my 2 1/2 year old granddaughter would love this as she likes puzzles and gadgets. The only issue is that the locks are very hard to open and close. It takes a bit of strength to maneuver them. Plus once you get something open it blocks the next door and gets tangled up causing frustration. Melissa & Doug products are quality all the way but are often way overpriced for a child's toy. You could probably make something yourself that would be less troublesome and at a much cheaper option. Maybe an older child would like this, but I can not recommend for children under 3 or 4.
customer_reviews.author: DML 59

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what to say beyond the fact that our toddler loves this. She got this for Christmas a couple months after she turned 2, and very quickly learned how the latches worked and (now that's she's 2 and a half and a little stronger) can even re-lock the the "lunch box" style latch (at least that's what I call it. The latch for #1) now that she's grown a bit. She loves undoing the latches, opening the doors, saying what it is that's in the door and counting them, and locking them back. It seems fairly well made for something manufactured on a large scale so that's a good perk, too.
customer_reviews.author: Travis W.

customer_reviews.title: It is a bit big (fit in my larger Jansport backpack but not in our backpack diaper bag and is a good 2 inches longer/wider than the airline tray) and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in anticipation of a 6 hour flight with my 1 year old and it saved the trip both on the plane and during car rides. It is a bit big (fit in my larger Jansport backpack but not in our backpack diaper bag and is a good 2 inches longer/wider than the airline tray) and the latches don't stay shut when picked up and moved around so it can be a little cumbersome to transport. BUT it's definitely worth the half hour+ that my kid spent entranced and quiet. Great for building his fine motor skills, too!
customer_reviews.author: Uncanny X-Mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent learning toy/tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for our curious grandson! This holds his attention for 30 - 45 minutes at a time. Amazing for a 16 month old. It actually taught him how to open things his mommy would rather he not know quite yet! Needless to say, we are pleased with this product. but have put it in the closet until his safety knowledge catches up to his motor skills!
customer_reviews.author: Patee Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Recommended by preschool teacher
customer_reviews.text: This is a recommendation from a friend who is a preschool teacher. I am glad I bought this. So far my son who is only 12 months old who is not old enough to open everything but loved open and close some of the simple door. Shiny lock and colorful board (sturdy a little heavy for a small child so we put it on the chair or table for him to play not rough edge for his tiny hands ). He has been playing with this everyday a little and not tired of it like other toy. Hope it will last untill he figure out all the locks by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Esperanza

customer_reviews.title: High quality; great for curious toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: We first saw this board in the play area at Santa's Village in Jefferson NH. It was the only activity that caught the attention of our 20-month old grand-daughter. We took note and bought her one for Xmas. It is a high-quality board and offers children a variety of latching options that seems to pique their natural curiosity for opening and shutting latches. Don't worry about this board falling apart! It uses solid wood and real metal parts. Nothing to hurt small fingers, very colorful and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Giova

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware of product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Christmas gift for my grandson. I gave it to him last night. He loved it, but within five minutes of play, two of the gold pins in one of the hinges fell out. This could have been dangerous to the child (choking hazard) if an adult had not been near by. I am not sure why the product failed. Please forward this to the makers of the activity set.
customer_reviews.author: KLR

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: I can’t handle that I am paying twice what I would pay for a different product when both are made in China it makes no sense. It’s a wooden board with metal latches and the fact that it’s hand painted in China makes me watch my child play with this and I can’t help but think of all the little underpaid children painting this by hand (maybe that’s not true idk but I can’t get that image out of my head). I would prefer to pay this price for something American made
customer_reviews.author: Diet Pepsi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy but arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Melissa and Doug make awesome toys and I always gift the kids in my life with one of their creations on holidays. This latch board is so cute. The graphics are great and the latches are big so they are easy to maneuver for little hands. I am disappointed the the product arrived damaged. It is the top right corner that is crushed and the paper is a little rolled back. VERY tempting for a child to pull and tear. There were other reviews that described this problem so I wonder if it is a glitch in the packing. I will let the company know but it is getting close to Christmas and i have to ship soon.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t my favorite Melissa and Doug toy. The design is so busy, I prefer the look of some of the latch boards with farm scenes, etc. The latch on the orange door always gets caught on the green door’s hardware, preventing the door from opening, which frustrates my toddler and causes him to come to me for help. Overall, he can’t really play with this very independently and needs my assistance a lot.
customer_reviews.author: theyangfam

customer_reviews.title: Adorable learning toy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is adorable. My 14mo is working on learning the locks. She loves seeing the animals behind the doors. There are varying degrees of complexity from one lock to the next, so she's working through them one at, a time. She's also learning colors, animals, and numbers! It might not be 100% Montessori but screw that, I'll take this any day. I can practically watch the brain synapses forming as she's working through it.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 1 year old. And he loves it! He's already figured out 4 of the locks without anyone showing how to do it. We just watch out for him to not step on it as he is still young (and technically younger than the 3+ suggested by the puzzle maker) and we can't explain to him really about the issues of stepping ON the puzzle. But it's great quality. Everything is secured nicely and safely. Definitely great for motor skills!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality toy.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. The doors would not close properly. The center door wouldn't close at all. My 3 yo grandson was very frustrated. In addition, a large sliver of wood lodged deep in his finger due to the poor quality of plywood and unfinished edges.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: A Great Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: Melissa and Doug products are awesome. My son is a teenager now but he has gone through all of their learning toys. I bought it for a three old toddler. He’s a busy body and he’s into opening and closing everything. It’s so normal for him and he’s developing! He’s working on his motor, hand eye coordination skills and more! Well, he loves playing with it. His grandmother said it’s a God sent gift since she could take some break when he’s so into it!
customer_reviews.author: Snow

customer_reviews.title: Such a creative idea! My 1.5 year old loves it.
customer_reviews.text: While this product is technically only suitable for ages 3+, I bought it for my 1.5 year old to play with (under my supervision). He LOVES opening and closing things, and playing with light switches/door handles/latches etc. Some of the latches are a little advanced for him but he still enjoys trying to figure it out. This is an adorable and sturdy toy. I feel like it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic educational activity
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our 18 month old granddaughter who loves to “tinker and help grandpa “ ( also bought Melissa & Doug tool box for her). She absolutely loves playing with it. It is colorful, well constructed and definitely gives her opportunities for challenge and learning. Great gift idea for those looking for a “quiet” educational toy.
customer_reviews.author: efbsews

customer_reviews.title: After 1 week...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, very good toy at first, but toddlers are very curious and learn very quickly with hands. What do you do with this when the child already mastered all these? For 22 dollars, this toy seems kind of simple now after maybe a week. I would suggest this for a group, institution, or daycare, where kids can practice these skills and move on.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Seems pricey but well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this thing. This is one of 2 Melissa & Doug "puzzles" that have survived donation reviews. I've had kids up to 8 years old play with this thing. It's hardy, and has put up with a lot of dropping on the floor. All doors shut evenly. It's impressive. I first thought it was a waste of money, but now, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: cksefton987

customer_reviews.title: No better gift for a little one
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 1 1/2 yr old grand-nephew. It was a hit with everyone. He absolutely loves it! He wants to carry it everywhere. His Grandma had to tie it down so he wouldn't fall with it and hurt himself. (remember, he is only 1 1/2). As a bonus, not he can learn how to untie knots! His Mommy said "Thanks a lot, not I won't be able to keep him out of anything!) I think next year I'll get him finger paints?
customer_reviews.author: icewoman

customer_reviews.title: Keeping ages 1-5 busy and productive 💗
customer_reviews.text: This is and was the best gift to get my grand girls. Even their mom said “you hit the mark on this gift they both love it”. The girls are one/four and they work the latches and enjoy learning, you can see their brains working as they play. I would have submitted a photo however, I am not fond of my girls photos being out on the web. This is a great any occasion gift, I took it just to give and it doesn’t take up a lot of space, easy to store and very durable...
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Souza

customer_reviews.title: Nice but has some surprise:-)
customer_reviews.text: I’ve just bought it, so I don’t know about its durability or even if my son will like it. I just want to ask the manufacturers, why does it stinks like a cowshed? Though I should say this way it resembles a real farmhouse much more:-) As for the quality, perhaps I’d like it more if the doors were more polished (their side parts). Though this thing is nice and should be interesting for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Liked the idea a lot and it could have been a really nice developmental toy except for a very poor quality which is way too below my expectations for this kind of price tag. Half the latches are a bit crooked and thus not easily manageable for my kid. Also opening one latch blocks other ones next to it. The paper picture glued to the wooden board arrived with too many scratches some of which were really big.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Road Trip Godsend
customer_reviews.text: This kept our 21 month old entertained through long car rides from Seattle to Kalispell, through Glacier, down to Big Sky, into Yellowstone, and back. It was a godsend! As he’s gotten older, he is starting to figure out more and more of the latch mechanics. It’s definitely a toy a child can grow with. His older sisters (5 & 7) enjoy it as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Coker

customer_reviews.title: Great interactive toy
customer_reviews.text: This latched board is wonderful! It is so well constructed that it is most likely quite durable. I bought this for my grandson who just turned two. He loved it. I told my daughter that if she ever locks anything up, to put the latch way up high because within a couple of months he’ll be able to unlock anything! 😂
customer_reviews.author: Wordsmith19

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is wonderful! Babies and older kids find it so much fun to try to latch and unlatch the doors! There are fun pictures behind each door, that teach counting and colors. I have taken a picture with the toy next to a can, so you can see the approximate size. This toy is well made and is a high-quality product. I highly recommend this toy. Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Overall great toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy. The only negative I can say is that the wood doors are definitely too scratchy for a child. I took sandpaper and sanded each one of them smooth. I think for the price of this toy that should have been done already. Other than that, the toy is awesome! My granddaughter LOVES it and spends a lot of time playing with it. It’s great that it includes learning for colors, numbers, and animals in addition to working on their motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: mindy

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: 1 year olds like this! They have figured out how to open most of the doors without any prompting or help. I like that it combines the physical aspect plus colors and counting. Very well made and good quality. The first time I ordered this, however, it never arrived, so I wouldnt wait until right before Xmas or a birthday to order.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Best present!
customer_reviews.text: My nephew found this latches board during play time at a library. He loved it so much he wouldn't play with anything else. I purchased one for him a few days later. Now he has a little sister 1 1/2 yrs old and he is almost 4. They both love it! I just recently got the board game for my other neice across country who just turned 2yrs old. Once she opened her present she didn't put it down. Her parents loved the fact there were no loose pieces.
customer_reviews.author: redpanda

customer_reviews.title: It’s a hit!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this wooden latch board. It’s very nicely made and all the latches work well. My little one is obsessed with opening and closing things so this is right up her ally. I am a bit confused though as it’s labeled for 3+, we gifted it to our daughter at 15 months and at 18 months she’s mastered the board. She definitely still has fun with it though and I thunk she’ll Luke it for awhile more but I’d think by 3 she’d be bored by it. Overall a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael dubois

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Very heavy. Bought for my 16 month old but decided to gift it to our 3 year old neighbor when they did a family long distance drive to see family. His mom said that it entertained him for a lot of time in the car. Will definitely have to purchase again for when it’s appropriate for my daughters age.
customer_reviews.author: Xutzen

customer_reviews.title: Your kiddos want this!
customer_reviews.text: This is just genius, right! So cute and fun for the kiddos. Such a easy cute concept executed in a way not easily achievable at home. I tried to diy something like this once and it came nowhere near with the time allowed. The kiddos love it! Great for hand, color, counting, etc development. Thank you Melisa and Doug for once again getting it of so right! Love you!
customer_reviews.author: Konnie F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas Present!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She is 10 months old but has been showing a lot of interest in locks. This toy was one of the favorites and still is several weeks later. She loves opening and shutting the little doors and squeals at the animals inside. This was a great purchase for her.
customer_reviews.author: Shelcg

customer_reviews.title: Very Delighted!
customer_reviews.text: For a 2 year old boy who loves to figure out how things work, this was a great gift! Each lock is different and is challenging enough to keep his little hands busy for a little time. The heavy wood construction means it will last through toddler abuse! This is a great item that I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M.N.

customer_reviews.title: Interactive,Colorful,Steady!
customer_reviews.text: I think is good toy for little brains development,colorful,interactive,keeps my baby busy and brings a lot of joy when he gets to open those little doors and gets to see who is hiding there! Good quality,it will survive every time that my baby drops it!Works for one year old as well!
customer_reviews.author: CristinaV

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Loves It, with Caveats
customer_reviews.text: We've only had this a little less than a week and so far so good. My 22-month-old enjoys locking and unlocking the latches, some of them more than others. But the reason I'm writing this review is because less than 5 minutes ago, he proceeded to unlock and open the "baby proof" gate to my bedroom. Coincidence? I think not. Just fair warning to anyone else who also has a toddler that regularly conspires against them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I am sad my son isnt more intrigued by this toy but I am not hating the toy for it. I know its really just his mood of the day. All in all it is sturdy, well made and the colors are eye grabbing. If he doesn't start playing with it I will definitely be re gifting to my god son.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining busy board
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves this board. He spent a good hour the first day looking at this board and working all the different latches and levers. He likes opening the doors to see the different animals underneath. This also reinforces his colors and numbers. I'm really pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: Erica L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift.
customer_reviews.text: suoer hit. I was nervous. Do the oarents wsbt their chikdcto know how tok unlock and work these hinges. He loves doirs. He needscto learn in case. so they loved it and so did he. There is always one toy the kid can't leave alone, well it was this one. Super hit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Trudy - Concept Muse

customer_reviews.title: Durable?
customer_reviews.text: This is a very age appropriate gift but if you have an independent thinker on your hands it could get tough. There are a few doors that are impossible to reset for a toddler because of their placement. I also question the long term durability because instead of being painted wood it’s printed paper pasted on wood which my toddler finds amusing to pull and fiddle with.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 17 month old son loves this! It challenges him to figure out how to open and close the locks and latches. He does some of them with ease and some he is still learning. The quality of the board is awesome! Very durable with some weight to it. It says age 3 and up, but it makes a great gift to any toddler younger than that. Worth the somewhat hefty price for an activity board!
customer_reviews.author: young c

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: You can’t go wrong with Melissa and Doug toys. My church had one of these in the two year old room and it was always a huge hit so I got one for my son. It’s really good for teaching dexterity and problem solving. It’s very well made and I love how colorful it is.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great toy that's well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. He was about 17 months when he started to play with it and now 5 months later still loves it. It is fun to watch him try to figure out how to undo the latches (he's mastered 3 of them). This is also a high quality piece. It is thick wood and pretty heavy for a toddler toy, but it will also last for years. The latches are well secured. This will definately be a hand-me-down item.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Just wish the latch came with a lock & key!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My two year old hasn’t stopped playing with it since he opened it! Some are more difficult to open than others, which I appreciate as he’s got something to work towards, but all in all he loves it! I only wish the latch (pic #2) came with a lock & key! It’s a no-brainer as is, the child only has to lift the latch... but I won’t knock a star off for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jae.

customer_reviews.title: My 9-month old grandson loved it
customer_reviews.text: While this is obviously meant for older children, my 9-month old grandson (under close supervision of his mother) absolutely loved it. I think it will be a toy to play with for a number of years, especially with a little brother on the way.
customer_reviews.author: C. Leyva

customer_reviews.title: I do NOT recommend at all
customer_reviews.text: The metallic pieces (locks) are sharp. Dangerous toy. That's a no no. I do NOT recommend at all. Beware ...
customer_reviews.author: Mina

customer_reviews.title: Melissa and Doug do not disappoint!  Heavily constructed  and colorful!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my soon- to-be 3 year old entertained for 20 minutes at a time, which is a lot for my busy bot. He lifts each door and counts out the creatures. I just heard him today opening each door and telling the fish, the frogs etc, a story. He is very quickly learning number recognition because of this book. He sees the 4 and says "4", then unlatches the door, opens it and says "4 orange goldfish". The dimensions of this latch board are much larger than a puzzle, so do not plan on putting it in a puzzle holder. It is heavily constructed, as like most Melissa and Doug items, it seems built to last a life-time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Our grandson loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson who is almost 2 yrs. old, loves this. It keeps him engaged because his hands are very busy. We love it. It's made of good quality materials, it's very durable. The doors open and the latches are accurate to the ones we use daily. We are satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and engaging toy, great for small motor development
customer_reviews.text: My son is 16 months and loves this toy, I know it is recommended for older kids but he’s already figured out all the latches and loves playing peekaboo with the animals behind each door! Great way to keep an active and curious toddler engaged!
customer_reviews.author: Javi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: Great learning tool for my daughter! The wood isn't finished around the edges of the door so you do have to watch out for splinters and I wish the door latch from number six opened in the other direction so it didn't interfere with number 5. But all in all it's a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, multiple skills
customer_reviews.text: I love how good the quality is on this board. It was much sturdier than I had expected. I had visions of taking it on a flight. Not so much. Their are a good variety of hooks with little pictures behind it. I bought this for my 1 yr old but my 3 yr old took it over for the first few days. I think it's a bit advanced for my 1 yr old but would be a great little entertainment for a 1-2 yr old. It's nice but I wouldn't expect to get the "wow!!!" Response from a child recipient if it's a holiday gift or birthday. It's just a nice something to have around
customer_reviews.author: Mother & Manager

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome toy! We started with this for our son before age 1 and now approaching age 2 it’s still going strong! It is very well made, the colors are bright and it keeps his attention. He loves opening and closing the doors to see the different animals. This is a favorite and we would recommend highly!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST Playboard everrrr!
customer_reviews.text: I love this, not only is it adorable, and educational but also keeps my 8 month old busy for 20-30 min at a time. My son when he was little was obsessed with locking and unlocking things like the ones on the board... So when I seen this I got it for my daughter and she loves it! Best purchase, but Melissa and Doug never disappoints anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Ray

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok for a small period of time
customer_reviews.text: Ok so my 2.5 yr old son got bored quickly with this one. He liked it but has left it in the corner. However my son is different than other kids and quickly gets bored with toys. It’s good and sturdy too. It would be a great gift for small child who likes opening and closing doors!
customer_reviews.author: Spikedidi

customer_reviews.title: Update !
customer_reviews.text: I received this today for my grandson ! Love the concept however mine is very warped? Anyone else have this issue ? I am going to return it for exchange! 3 stars because it’s warped UPDATE ...lol well it finally came to be today the board is NOT warped ..it is made that way so you can pick it up off a flat surface ! It’s awesome and my 15 month of grandson loves it !
customer_reviews.author: Tonja

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, not perfect execution. It works, but fits in the “just okay” category. Some doors, latches, and hinges are wiggly which causes them to not fit well together. Overall, I’m content, but it could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Chussell

customer_reviews.title: I love Melissa and Doug toys!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson, who is now 7 mos old. Melissa and Doug puzzles are well constructed, have big, chunky pieces and are very bright and creative, which is why I purchased this. I had been looking for a latch, lock puzzle for awhile when I decided to purchase this. As much as I don't want to encourage him to undo his safety latch at home or to know how to open things he should not get into, THIS IS FUN! I've purchased so many Melissa and Doug creative food kits and puzzles for both of my grand sons becasue of the enjoyment that comes from them.
customer_reviews.author: joshandles

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping my 2yo would love this a lot more than he actually does. But the quality is good and I don't regret my purchase. I ended up mounting it to the wall with some command strips because it does take up quite a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Shiloh

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: This product is super cute. It kept my daughter entertained for like 30min to an hour for a week straight. She loves how they open up to animal pictures. Super cute and really good for a 2 1/2 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Pattie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this! Some of the patches are easy and simpler and she got it quicker but there are still about 4 that she is still learning and trying to get and understand. Perfect for a curious toddler and perfect to keep her distracted.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: The good, the bad, and the ugly of this toy
customer_reviews.text: GOOD: People really like it and it's colorful and cute, with lots of gadgets to play with. BAD: My kid just isn't interested, lol. He's into everything so it was a surprise but maybe one day. UGLY: These hurt like a mother if you step on them!
customer_reviews.author: cheluzal

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of this brand and how their products are made. But this puzzle is great! I bought this for my 14 month old, and he can now lock and unlock five out of the six locks at 16 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Metwally

customer_reviews.title: One is my favorite M&D toys
customer_reviews.text: Love anything M&D and this did not disappoint!!! My daughter is 19 months and she loves this puzzle. She plays with it almost everyday. It is very durable and great quality. Would buy for a gift if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Analee M

customer_reviews.title: This board is colorful and teaches coordination!
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old Great Grandson loves this toy and plays with it all the time! The only ones not too happy with my present are his parents, it’s already teaching him to open doors he shouldn’t!
customer_reviews.author: Renate Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old nephew loves latches and buckles. This was the PERFECT gift for him. He loved it and while some parts were easy for him to maneuver and open, some were still a challenge, so he'll be able to use this for a while. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Heather C.

customer_reviews.title: Good learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Good learning tool. Just taking one star off because it came scratched up and was bent slightly on one corner. It appears to have already been used by the looks of it and the packaging. But no big deal. It works for my kids. However, I don’t think Amazon should be selling items as “new” if it’s not. That is a kinda big deal when you are paying for something “new.”
customer_reviews.author: Live Life Hapily

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 2yr old son to use while on a 4 hr car ride. Didn’t entertain him for a long time only b/c he doesn’t have patience yet, but the concept is great. Quality materials used to make this board. I can see it lasting a long time. Will update if there are any defects
customer_reviews.author: rachealwilk

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my little one because she is obsessed with playing with this board at her doctor’s office. It arrived in a very well protected box and arrived in perfect condition. This is a great product; I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AlyssaD

customer_reviews.title: Well made and challenging
customer_reviews.text: This very well made, colorful toy has so many fun features. Got this for our 2yo grandson and there are a few locks he still needs help with but as he develops he’ll love succeeding at the hard ones. This toy is great for counting, learning colors, manipulating the doors and locks, learning about open and closed, animal identification and dexterity. He goes back to this toy time and again!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: best game for 18months kids
customer_reviews.text: The best game for my baby. I hold on it in a store-basket for long time, waiting until his hands grow well to the locks' opening. Most of all he likes the animals that are hidden, he even learned who exactly are hidden there without opening the door. Wonderful board and at one it is reaching four goals - learning colors, animals, building's shapes, opening locks. When I have read detailed information before buying the game I found that it is for ages 2-3, but my son did all this in his 18 months. Bright colors, paint is not erased, strong and hard board, precisely to play sitting at the table.
customer_reviews.author: Quaternion M

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but mine arrived with peeling wood
customer_reviews.text: Love this latches board I ordered instead of trying to make a busy board for my 18-month- old son. However I'm really disappointed that one of the doors had peeled wood immediately upon taking it out of the packaging. My son picked more wood off the damaged area as soon as he got that latch undone. I will have to return it if I can't figure out how to fix it so he can't pick off more pieces.
customer_reviews.author: LTTaniguchiTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: ) played happily with it
customer_reviews.text: Even the 8-year-old was enjoying this, along with his 4-year-old cousin. When they were done, little sister (18 mos.) played happily with it, too. The boys enjoyed shutting the doors and "locking the animals up." Girls like to set them free! It looks like it will last for a long time, and Mom was happy that it has no loose pieces, so it can travel with them this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: She knows!
customer_reviews.text: My two y.o. granddaughter wants to play with this EVERYtime she is at my place. She sings, manipulates, and cries out in pleasure EACH time she solves a closure. I would be a zillionaire if I had known that what my mother and father had done for me eons ago, would be such a pleasure to kids today. Of course, it was plywood without the funny graphics.
customer_reviews.author: GKR

customer_reviews.title: This is a great concept, however very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept, however very poor quality. The back looks like wood yet it's just paper that's peeling off, where there's no sticker the wood is unfinished and there's splinters coming out of it, the front is also just stickers and it's peeling by the edges. All this after a few minutes of supervised play. I got splinters just by holding the board. Have to send it back for a refund unfortunately, my son loves the toy but it's just not safe.
customer_reviews.author: TodiM

customer_reviews.title: I would gift this to any child working on fine motor skills.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy and can do this independently. It works on fine motor skills and logic. I love Melissa and Doug toys, but this is one of the sturdiest ones I have purchased. This is a great addition to any puzzle collection.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Gill

customer_reviews.title: Will last forever!
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. I bought it for my one year old grandson so it will be a bit before he figures it out but he likes messing around with it. It was a great find. Busy boards are ridiculously expensive! This was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So many ways to use the latches board!
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed. Bright colors. Cute images. Multiple ways to use the latches board - not only opening the latches, but learning colors and describing images.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Latch Board
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for daycare and the kids have enjoyed it. I always had issues with kids learning how to undo locks...not sure how I feel about this still...but I've noticed that after a few months they really don't play with it anymore. It will probably become one of the toys that gets rotated. There are a couple of cons: Many kids like stepping on toys instead of picking them up, and because of this, the yellow doors on ours have become a little warped or something. Also it is very heavy, so the kids sometimes have a hard time carrying it around.
customer_reviews.author: SCoop

customer_reviews.title: Educational Toy
customer_reviews.text: Our 2-year-old son discovered this product in a local store and entertained himself for an hour. We purchased it as a gift some time after. It is at once entertaining and educational, although we have mentioned - in jest - that this may train him to overcome some of our child safety locks...
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but durable, workable, and beloved by our little one!
customer_reviews.text: Our 17-month-old has been playing with this since we got it for her a few months ago. If you have a little one who likes keys, clasps, latches, etc., this is a great toy for busy little figure-it-outers! Ours is already an escape artist - now she just has a few more tricks up her sleeve. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eyaya

customer_reviews.title: Nice,  But
customer_reviews.text: This is a great manipulative but the sixth door jams up almost every time it is opened because the latch catches on the lock next door. It has been very frustrating to use but she is now figuring it out so maybe that is a lesson in itself.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl pelletier

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for Cognitive and Coordination
customer_reviews.text: I am always impressed with Melissa and Doug brand toys for their timeless designs and quality craftwork, so I was excited to see that they created a latch board. After all the gifts were unwrapped and she quickly became bored with her Christmas haul, our almost two year old still quietly plays with her latch board. She has always had an interest in putting things together and learning how things work. Because it has real metal fixtures, and is pretty solid, she feels like she has something maybe she wouldn't normally be allowed to play with.
customer_reviews.author: SterlingMom

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Inquisitive Son Entertained
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 2 year old son (25 months). He seemed intrigued when I took it out of the box. He immediately started playing with it and figuring out all the latches. It holds his attention long enough for me to unload and reload the dishwasher or throw in a load of laundry. I am quite happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B. Royal

customer_reviews.title: Fun sensory toy
customer_reviews.text: My son has enjoyed opening and closing all the locks on this puzzle board. He also has learned colors and animals and I quiz him to show me which one is which. He will play with it for a few minutes but then is on to another toy. The locks are good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Britney Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Educational & Entertaining for 18-mo Old
customer_reviews.text: My 18-mo old is obsessed with this! It is a fabulously large size, which makes it even more fun. She loves the latches, the doors, AND the animals behind the doors. There is so much learning potential with this toy, from hand-eye coordination to colors, animals, and numbers. Definitely a great investment!
customer_reviews.author: oldlakefan

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept but Filled with Saw Dust
customer_reviews.text: Really love the concept of this puzzle but very disappointed that they wouldn't make sure to blow out of dust off the saw dust out and of the puzzle before selling it. It's a great idea with a nice design but we'd really appreciate the extra care and attention to quality especially since these don't come cheap and we are giving the puzzles to our little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Can hold a baby's interest for 5-10 mins
customer_reviews.text: Baby's love latches. At least mine does. I bought this for her 1st birthday and I love watching her little brain work as she figures out how to manipulate this toy. It's nice to have something she enjoys that doesn't play loops of god awful noise and produce seizure inducing flashes of light.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Nice fitting doors and good quality hardware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my almost 3 year old grandson who is not very impressed with most of his toys, but this is one that he goes for and plays with. He can do some of the latches without help and will then there are others he likes to be shown how they work and keeps at trying to do them alone. The reason for 4 stars is because of Melissa & Doug's use of pictures on wood that scratch and peel so easily. Otherwise, the doors all open and close easily and fit nicely and the hardware is good quality without sharp or rough edges.
customer_reviews.author: J Christine

customer_reviews.title: GIFT ITEM
customer_reviews.text: Very colorful and looks very sturdy, just as pictured. Gift for autistic child. I have no idea how well it was received and used by the child or how it holds up, but I can tell you I was impressed when I saw. Beautiful gift item.
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: My daughter's new favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter always plays with these at the doctor's office, and she gets mad when it's time to leave because she wants to keep playing with it. So I decided to buy her one to play with at home. She plays with this every single day and never gets tired of it. Definitely worth buying!!
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My two year olds are now break out artists thanks to this toy. They have a ton of fun working the latches and locks. Numbers, colors and animals help extend playtime (Where are the fish? What's behind door #3?, etc)
customer_reviews.author: ALAN E BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Great for little hands and minds.
customer_reviews.text: Great gift! I gave this as a birthday gift to a two-year-old. He’s a busy little boy, and a regular puzzle wouldn’t hold his interest. This kept his interest as he figures but out how to work each lock and latch. His older sister liked it too.
customer_reviews.author: Stenogirl

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Latches Board
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingUndo a lock or latch, swing open the numbered door, and count on finding fun when the picture beneath is revealed on this wooden play board and educational toy! Build fine motor skills while learning colors, numbers, animals, and more! Melissa & Doug hands-on toys for preschoolers are designed to help younger children build fine and gross motor skills, while also discovering vibrant colors, numbers, animals, and more. Our activity boards for toddlers are made from smooth-sanded, solid-wood material that features fun surprises behind the opening doors and windows. Parents and older kids can engage with children 3 and up by playing multiple games including counting animals behind the doors and windows, locating specific colors, and identifying the type of animals displayed. This Wooden Latches Board makes a great gift for children ages 3 and up. Add the Melissa & Doug See & Spell Learning Toy to round out the hands-on, screen-free play and learning. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: ENTERTAINING ACTIVITY PLAY BOARD: The Melissa & Doug Wooden Latches Board is an entertaining and educational activity play board that helps kids build dexterity as they navigate latches that hook, snap, click, and slide.
STURDY WOOD CONSTRUCTION: Our activity boards for toddlers are made from smooth-sanded, solid-wood material that features fun surprises behind the opening doors and windows.

HELPS DEVELOP MULTIPLE SKILLS: Melissa & Doug hands-on toys for preschoolers are designed to help younger children build fine and gross motor skills, while also discovering vibrant colors, numbers, animals, and more.

GIFT FOR AGES 3 AND UP: This Wooden Latches Board makes a great gift for children ages 3 and up. Add the Melissa & Doug See & Spell Learning Toy to round out the hands-on, screen-free play and learning.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE: We design every toy to the highest quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts. If your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right. Our phone number is on every product!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,026 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
